info.title: Computational Toxicology and Exposure (CTX) APIs - CTX Bioactivity API
info.description: The CTX Bioactivity API is part of US EPA's Computational Toxicology and Exposure APIs. The CTX Bioactivity API provides programmtic access to bioactivity data through a set of endpoints.

tags.name: Bioactivity Assay Resource
tags.description: Collection of endpoints for assay annotations. Annotations describe who conducted the assay, what platform was used, what was being measured (raw readout), and how the measurement was interpreted (normalized component data). Assay annotations facilitate data interpretation by allowing users to flexibly aggregate and differentiate processed data. These curated data sourced from US EPA's Toxicity Forecaster (ToxCast) invitrodb.

tags.name: Bioactivity Data Resource
tags.description: Collection of endpoints with multiple-concentration targeted bioactivity screening data. These curated data sourced from US EPA's Toxicity Forecaster (ToxCast) invitrodb.

tags.name: Bioactivity Model Resource
tags.description: Collection of endpoints for prediction results from ToxCast bioactivity models. The publications associated with the ToxCast Pathway Models are: 1) ESTROGEN: As described in Browne, et al (2015) DOI: 10.1021/acs.est.5b02641 and presented to December 2014 FIFRA SAP under EPA-HQ-OPP-2014-0614. 2) ANDROGEN: As described in Kleinstreuer et al (2017) 10.1021/acs.chemrestox.6b00347 and presented to November 2017 FIFRA SAP under EPA-HQ-OPP-2017-0214.

tags.name: Analytical QC Resource
tags.description: Endpoint for Analytical QC data to inform the chemical's applicability domain for in vitro screening at the sample and substance level. These curated data sourced from US EPA's Toxicity Forecaster (ToxCast) invitrodb.

tags.name: Assay Name Search Resource
tags.description: Collection of endpoints for searching by assay name. Search string options include starts-with, exact, or contains.

tags.name: CCD AOP Data Resource
tags.description: Collection of endpoints used to populate CompTox Chemicals Dashboard (CCD) Adverse Outcome Pathway (AOP) and Key Event (KE) links within the ToxCast Summary Grid. Curated mappings of AOPs and KEs for individual ToxCast assay endpoints are made available in ToxCast's invitrodb.

post.summary: Get data for a batch of SPIDs
post.description: return data for requested sample IDs (SPIDs)

post.summary: Get data for a batch of M4IDs
post.description: return data for requested Level 4 IDs (M4IDs), corresponding to the individual modeled endpoint-sample concentration-responses

post.summary: Get bioactivity data for a batch of DTXSIDs

requestBody.description: JSON array of DSSTox Substance Identifiers

post.summary: Get data for a batch of AEIDs
post.description: return data for requested ToxCast assay component endpoint IDs (AEIDs)

requestBody.description: JSON array of ToxCast assay component endpoint IDs (AEIDs)

post.summary: Get AED data for a batch of DTXSIDs
post.description: return administered equivalent dose (AED) data derived from ToxCast in vitro bioactivity data for given DTXSIDs

requestBody.description: JSON array of DSSTox Substance Identifiers

post.summary: Get assay annotations for a batch of AEIDs
post.description: return assay annotations for requested ToxCast assay component endpoint IDs (AEIDs)

requestBody.description: JSON array of DSSTox Substance Identifiers

get.description: NOTE: Search value needs to be URL encoded for synonyms
NOTE: Search value needs to be URL encoded for synonyms
NOTE: Search value needs to be URL encoded for synonyms
return ToxCast model predictions for a given DTXSID

get.summary: Get predictions by DTXSID and model
get.description: return ToxCast model predictions for given a DTXSID and model type. Model type options include: 'CERAPP Potency Level (Consensus)', 'CERAPP Potency Level (From Literature)', 'COMPARA (Consensus)', and 'ToxCast Pathway Model (AUC)'

get.summary: Get summary data by DTXSID and assay tissue origin
get.description: return summary data for given DTXSID and the assay format's tissue origin
return summary of active hits and total multi- and single-concentration assays tested for given DTXSID
return summary of active hits and total multi- and single-concentration chemicals tested for given ToxCast assay component endpoint ID (AEID)
return data for given sample ID (SPID)
return data for given Level 4 ID (M4ID), corresponding to the individual modeled endpoint-sample concentration-response

Return data for a given DTXSID. There is an available projection aligned with what's available on the CCD ToxCast Summary plot: toxcast-summary-plot. If no projection is specified, a default BioactivityDataAll projection will be returned.

parameters.name: projection
parameters.description: Specifies if projection is used. Option: toxcast-summary-plot. If omitted, the default BioactivityDataAll data is returned.

get.description: Return data by ToxCast assay component endpoint ID (AEID)
return administered equivalent dose (AED) data derived from ToxCast in vitro bioactivity data for given DTXSID

get.summary: Get single conc data by AEID
get.description: return single concentration screening data for requested ToxCast assay component endpoint ID (AEID)

get.summary: Get assay summary by gene symbol
get.description: Return assay summary data, including percentage of single and multiple-concentration screening actives, for applicable assays for requested offical gene symbol.

get.summary: Get AEID by assay component endpoint name

get.description: return assay annotations by ToxCast assay component endpoint ID (AEID) based on the specified projection. Available projections: ccd-assay-annotation, ccd-assay-gene, ccd-assay-citations, ccd-assay-tcpl, ccd-assay-reagents, assay-all. If no projection is specified, the full view of assay annotations will be returned by default.

parameters.name: projection
parameters.description: Specifies which projection to use. Options: ccd-assay-annotation, ccd-assay-gene, ccd-assay-citations, ccd-assay-tcpl, ccd-assay-reagents, assay-all. If omitted, the full assay data is returned.

404.description: No data found for the given AEID

get.description: return list of chemicals (DTXSIDs) tested by ToxCast assay component endpoint ID (AEID).

get.summary: Get AOP data by ToxCast AEID
get.description: Return ToxCast-mapped AOP data for a given ToxCast assay component endpoint ID (AEID)

get.summary: Get AOP data by Key Event
get.description: Return ToxCast-mapped AOP data for a given Key Event (KE) number

get.summary: Get AOP data by Entrez Gene ID
get.description: Return ToxCast-mapped AOP data for a given Entrez Gene ID

get.summary: Get analytical QC data by DTXSID
get.description: return analytical QC data for requested DTXSID

AssayAnnotation.description: US EPA's Toxicity Forecaster (ToxCast) program makes invitro medium- and high-throughput screening assay data publicly available for prioritization and hazard characterization. Given ToxCast includes a heterogeneous set of assays across a diverse biological space, annotations in the database help flexibly aggregate and differentiate processed data. The definition of an assay is, in ToxCast, broken into 4 assay elements: assay source: the vendor/origination of the data, assay: the procedure to generate the component data, assay component: the raw data readout(s), assay component endpoint: the normalized component data. The assay element annotations are often short in a standardized format or use a controlled term list. Assay resource endpoints provide assay metadata for specific or all invitrodb aeids (assay endpoint ids). These include annotations from invitrodbs assay, assay_component, assay_component_endpoint, assay_list, assay_source, and gene tables, all returned in a by-aeid format. Regular ToxCast/invitrodb users may find it easier to use the tcpl R package, which has integrated to make API data retrievable in a familiar format. See the tcpl vignette regarding data retrieval via API for more information.

assayComponentEndpointName.description: Assay component endpoint name (abbreviated 'aenm' within the package)

assayFunctionType.description: Description of targeted mechanism and the purpose of the analyzed readout in relation to others from the same assay

normalizedDataType.description: Normalization approach for which the data is displayed

burstAssay.description: Indicator if endpoint is included in the burst distribution (1) or not (0); Burst phenomenon can describe confounding activity, such as cytotoxicity due to non-specific activation of many targets at certain concentrations

keyPositiveControl.description: Tested chemical sample expected to produce activity; Used to assess assay validity

signalDirection.description: Directionality of raw data signals from assay (gain or loss); Defines analysis direction

intendedTargetType.description: General group of intended targets measured

intendedTargetTypeSub.description: Specific subgroup of intended targets measured

intendedTargetFamily.description: Family of intended target measured; Populated on ToxCast chemical activity plot within CompTox dashboard

intendedTargetFamilySub.description: Specific subfamily of intended target measured

cellViabilityAssay.description: Indicator of the impact of cytotoxicity in confounding (1) or no cytotoxic impact (0)

assayComponentName.description: Assay component name (abbreviated 'acnm' within the package)

assayComponentTargetDesc.description: Assay component target description. Generally includes information about mechanism of action with assay target, how disruption is detected, or significance of target disruption.

assayDesignType.description: General description of the biological or physical process is translated into a detectable signal by assay mechanism

assayDesignTypeSub.description: Specific description of method through which a biological or physical process is translated into a detectable signal measured

biologicalProcessTarget.description: General biological process being chemically disrupted

detectionTechnologyType.description: General description of assay platform or detection signals measured

detectionTechnologyTypeSub.description: Description of signals measured in assay platform

detectionTechnology.description: Specific description of assay platform used

keyAssayReagentType.description: Type of critical reactant being measured

technologicalTargetType.description: General description of technological target measured in assay platform

technologicalTargetTypeSub.description: Specific description of technological target measured in assay platform

organismId.description: NCBI taxonomic identifier, available here https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy

cellFreeComponentSource.description: Description of source for targeted cell-free components

contentReadoutType.description: Description of well characteristics being measured

dilutionSolventPercentMax.description: Maximum percent of dilution solvent used, from 0 to 1.

assaySourceName.description: Assay source name (typically an abbreviation of the assay_source_long_name, abbreviated 'asnm' within the package)

assayList.description: JSON object containing curated groupings of endpoints anchored by use in CCTE publications and/or projects

citations.description: JSON object containing references to assay-specific publications describing assay design or results

mc3Methods.description: JSON object containing Level 3 Multi-concentration (MC3) normalized concentration-response data

mc4Methods.description: JSON object containing Level 4 Multi-concentration (MC4) All Models Fitting Parameters

mc5Methods.description: JSON object containing Level 5 Multi-concentration (MC5) Winning Model Fitting Parameters

mc6Methods.description: JSON object containing Level 6 Multi-concentration (MC6) Flags

api_key.description: Each API request requires an api_key. Contact the CTX API Admin to request an API Key.
api_key.name: x-api-key
